Package uk.ac.ed.inf.aqmaps.noflyzone

Class ObstaclePathfinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.inf.aqmaps.noflyzone.ObstaclePathfinder
  • public class ObstaclePathfinder
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles obstacle evasion. Uses Obstacles and an ObstacleGraph to find paths between points which do not collides with any obstacles.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private ObstacleGraph graph
      A weighted graph containing all points which form an outline around the polygons as vertices, and edges connecting them if they have line of sight, which have a weight equal to the distance between them.
      private Obstacles obstacles  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ObstaclePathfinder​(ObstacleGraph graph, Obstacles obstacles)
      Construct an Obstacle evader with the given graph and obstacles.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void addEdgeIfHasLineOfSight​(Coords A, Coords B)
      Adds an edge between points A and B if they have line of sight to each other, or in other words if the line between them does not collide with an obstacle.
      java.util.List<Coords> getPathBetweenPoints​(Coords start, Coords end)
      Find the shortest path between the start and end points, navigating around obstacles if necessary.
      private org.jgrapht.GraphPath<Coords,​org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultWeightedEdge> getShortestPath​(Coords start, Coords end)
      Computes a GraphPath containing the shortest path from the start to the end coordinates, navigating around obstacles if required.
      double getShortestPathLength​(Coords start, Coords end)
      Find the length of the shortest path between the start and end points, navigating around obstacles if necessary.

      • graph

        private final ObstacleGraph graph
        A weighted graph containing all points which form an outline around the polygons as vertices, and edges connecting them if they have line of sight, which have a weight equal to the distance between them.

    • Method Detail

      • getPathBetweenPoints

        public java.util.List<Coords> getPathBetweenPoints​(Coords start,
                                                   Coords end)
        Find the shortest path between the start and end points, navigating around obstacles if necessary.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting point
        end - the ending point
        Returns:
        a list of points specifying the route

      • getShortestPathLength

        public double getShortestPathLength​(Coords start,
                                    Coords end)
        Find the length of the shortest path between the start and end points, navigating around obstacles if necessary. Euclidean distance is used as the length measure.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting point
        end - the ending point
        Returns:
        the length of the path in degrees

      • getShortestPath

        private org.jgrapht.GraphPath<Coords,​org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultWeightedEdge> getShortestPath​(Coords start,
                                                                                                  Coords end)
        Computes a GraphPath containing the shortest path from the start to the end coordinates, navigating around obstacles if required.
        Parameters:
        start - the start point
        end - the end point
        Returns:
        a GraphPath

      • addEdgeIfHasLineOfSight

        private void addEdgeIfHasLineOfSight​(Coords A,
                                     Coords B)
        Adds an edge between points A and B if they have line of sight to each other, or in other words if the line between them does not collide with an obstacle. Sets the edge weight to the distance between the points.
        Parameters:
        A - point A
        B - point B
